assertions:
#[test]
fn test_count_equal_subarrays() {
    assert_eq!(count_equal_subarrays(&[1, 2, 3]), 3);        // No equal adjacent elements
    assert_eq!(count_equal_subarrays(&[1, 1, 1]), 6);        // All elements equal
    assert_eq!(count_equal_subarrays(&[1, 1, 2, 2, 2]), 8);  // Mixed equal and unequal
    assert_eq!(count_equal_subarrays(&[]), 0);               // Empty array
    assert_eq!(count_equal_subarrays(&[5]), 1);              // Single element
    assert_eq!(count_equal_subarrays(&[1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3]), 10); // Multiple groups
}

assertions:
#[test]
fn test_count_set_bits_in_range() {
    assert_eq!(count_set_bits_in_range(0, 0), 0);    // Single number 0
    assert_eq!(count_set_bits_in_range(1, 1), 1);    // Single number 1
    assert_eq!(count_set_bits_in_range(0, 1), 1);    // Range with two numbers
    assert_eq!(count_set_bits_in_range(2, 5), 5);    // Small range
    assert_eq!(count_set_bits_in_range(10, 15), 17); // Medium range
    assert_eq!(count_set_bits_in_range(0, 255), 1024); // Larger range covering all 8-bit numbers
}

assertions:
#[test]
fn test_can_reach_target_sum() {
    assert_eq!(can_reach_target_sum(&[1, 2, 3, 4], 7), true);  // 3+4 = 7
    assert_eq!(can_reach_target_sum(&[1, 2, 3, 4], 10), false); // no subset sums to 10
    assert_eq!(can_reach_target_sum(&[3, 34, 4, 12, 5, 2], 9), true);  // 4+5 = 9
    assert_eq!(can_reach_target_sum(&[], 0), true); // empty subset sums to 0
    assert_eq!(can_reach_target_sum(&[1, 1, 1, 1], 4), true);  // 1+1+1+1 = 4
    assert_eq!(can_reach_target_sum(&[5, 10, 15], 25), true);  // 10+15 = 25
}

assertions:
#[test]
fn test_count_attack_pairs() {
    assert_eq!(count_attack_pairs(&vec![1, 2, 3, 4]), 6);    // All pairs satisfy the condition
    assert_eq!(count_attack_pairs(&vec![4, 3, 2, 1]), 0);    // No pairs satisfy the condition
    assert_eq!(count_attack_pairs(&vec![2, 1, 3, 4]), 4);    // Some pairs satisfy the condition
    assert_eq!(count_attack_pairs(&vec![1, 1, 1, 1]), 0);    // No pairs satisfy the condition (all equal)
    assert_eq!(count_attack_pairs(&vec![1, 3, 2, 4]), 5);    // Mixed case
}

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s
assertions:
#[test]
fn test_evaluate_boolean_expression() {
    let test_cases = vec![
        ("T", true),
        ("F", false),
        ("!T", false),
        ("!F", true),
        ("T&T", true),
        ("T&F", false),
        ("F&T", false),
        ("F&F", false),
        ("T|T", true),
        ("T|F", true),
        ("F|T", true),
        ("F|F", false),
        ("!(T|F)", false),
        ("!T&!F", false),
        ("!(T&F)", true),
        ("T&(F|T)", true),
        ("(T|F)&(F|T)", true),
        ("!T|!(F&T)", false),
    ];
    
    for (expr, expected) in test_cases {
        assert_eq!(evaluate_boolean_expression(expr), expected);
    }
}
